column1: All members of the Cabinet maintain absolute silence regarding what step will follow the action of the Chamber. Former Ministers and other men prominent in public affairs declare
column3: that the action of Parliament virtually was a declaration of war.When the Chamber reassembled this afternoon after its long recess there were present 482 Deputies out of 500
column4: the absentees remaining away on account of illness. The Deputies especially applauded were those who wore military uniforms and who had asked permission for leave from their military duties to be present at the sitting.All the tribunes were filled to overflowing. No representatives of Germany
column6: or Turkey were to be seen in the diplomatic tribune. The first envoy to arrive was Thomas Nelson Page
column8: who was accompanied by his staff. M. Barrère
column15: appeared a few minutes later and all were greeted with applause
column16: which was shared by the Belgian
column18: and Rumanian Ministers. George B. McClellan
column20: occupied a seat in the President's tribune.
